revised_title: Gavin Rylands de Beer: A Pioneering Zoologist and Educator
tldr: This biographical memoir recounts the life and career of Gavin Rylands de Beer, a prominent zoologist and educator. Born in Paris, de Beer was raised in Europe and developed a deep interest in languages, history, and literature. He attended Harrow School and later went on to study zoology at Oxford. De Beer's research focused on embryology, comparative anatomy, and experimental zoology. He made significant contributions to the field and was a dedicated educator, teaching at both the undergraduate and graduate levels. Throughout his life, de Beer maintained a strong connection to his alma mater, Oxford, and was a Fellow of Merton College.
